revision.text:
{{WikiProject Computing |class=Start |importance= |amiga=yes |amiga-importance=High}} == Separate article for the Amiga 4000T? == Should we have a separate article for the A4000T? It is a separate model with, I believe, significant differences. At the least this article should probably be cleaned up so it doesn't confuse the two so much (e.g., the way it says there are two models - the 030 and 040 versions - but the 4000T is yet another model). [[User:Mdwh|Mdwh]] 23:08, 27 June 2006 (UTC) :No objections, so I've created [[Amiga 4000T]]. [[User:Mdwh|Mdwh]] 00:16, 6 July 2006 (UTC) == This could perhaps be written more clearly ==
They also made use of a Lithium Ion backup battery rather than a NiCd. This backup battery is also one of the most common causes of problems in the aging A4000s: it has a tendency to eventually leak. The released fluids are somewhat corrosive and can eventually damage the motherboard.
Which battery had the leak problem? The NiCd or the LiIon? the barrel batterry that it came with- the backup as u call the fix. Its simply a standard battery used in todays computer. :Well, since the first sentence clearly states that it does not have a NiCd battery, I don't think this is very unclear? [[User:Pipatron|Pipatron]] ([[User talk:Pipatron|talk]]) 18:00, 17 April 2008 (UTC) == CPU cart exists in Amiga 3000 == "Unlike previous Amiga models, early A4000 machines have the CPU mounted in an expansion board;" It is not true. Amiga 3000 has CPU cart compatible with A4000. Many custom CPU cards (turbo cards) compatible with A3000 and A4000 (simultaneously) were available in the market. â€” Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[Special:Contributions/83.238.150.131|83.238.150.131]] ([[User talk:83.238.150.131|talk]]) 10:37, 29 February 2012 (UTC) :The early A4000s have no CPU on the motherboard. [[User:Zac67|Zac67]] ([[User talk:Zac67|talk]]) 16:37, 4 April 2013 (UTC) == Resolution == One resolution is listed as 1024x768i. I never had that resolution on my A4000, so where does that come from? [[Special:Contributions/84.49.75.226|84.49.75.226]] ([[User talk:84.49.75.226|talk]]) 11:31, 4 April 2013 (UTC) :Good point - I've just sourced it. [[User:Zac67|Zac67]] ([[User talk:Zac67|talk]]) 16:37, 4 April 2013 (UTC)
